javaslang

Interface FilterMonadic<M extends Kind<M,?>,T>

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Kind<M,T>
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    Arbitrary<T>, Gen<T>, IndexedSeq<T>, Iterator<T>, LinearSeq<T>, List<T>, Map<K,V>, Match.MatchMonad<R>, Option<T>, Seq<T>, Set<T>, SortedSet<T>, Stack<T>, Stream<T>, Traversable<T>, TraversableOnce<T>, Tree<T>, Try<T>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    Array, CharSeq, Either.LeftProjection, Either.RightProjection, Failure, HashMap, HashSet, Iterator.ConcatIterator, Iterator.DistinctIterator, Lazy, List.Cons, List.Nil, Match.MatchMonad.Otherwise, Match.MatchMonad.When.Then, None, Queue, Some, Stream.Cons, Stream.Nil, Success, Tree.Empty, Tree.Node, TreeSet, Vector

    public interface FilterMonadic<M extends Kind<M,?>,T>
extends Kind<M,T>
    FilterMonadic is an abstraction for filter-monadic operations.

    Likewise to Scala, a FilterMonadic type is not a real monad. See Is a collection with flatMap a monad?.

    Since:
    2.0.0

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from interface javaslang.Kind

        Kind.IterableKind<T>

    • Method Summary

      Flat maps the elements of this elements of a new type preserving their order, if any.

    • Method Detail

      • filter

        FilterMonadic<M,T> filter(Predicate<? super T> predicate)
        Returns a new FilterMonadic consisting of all elements which satisfy the given predicate.
        Parameters:
        predicate - A predicate
        Returns:
        a new FilterMonadic instance
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if predicate is null

      • flatMapM

        <U> FilterMonadic<M,U> flatMapM(Function<? super T,? extends Kind<? extends M,? extends U>> mapper)
        Flat maps the elements of this elements of a new type preserving their order, if any.

        This method effectively does call 

        this.flatMap((Function<? super T, ? extends M<? extends U>>) mapper);
        It exists, because Java's type system (the lack of higher-order kinds) does not allow us to define an interface containing the mentioned flatMap method.
        Type Parameters:
        U - Component type of the flat mapped FilterMonadic
        Parameters:
        mapper - A mapper.
        Returns:
        a flat mapped FilterMonadic
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if mapper is null

      • flatten

        FilterMonadic<M,Object> flatten()
        Flattens a FilterMonadic.

        The semantics may vary from class to class. The commonality is, that some kind of wrapped state is recursively unwrapped.

        Example: 

        ((1, 2), 3, (4, (5, 6))).flatten() = (1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6)
        Returns:
        A flattened version of this FilterMonadic.

      • map

        <U> FilterMonadic<M,U> map(Function<? super T,? extends U> mapper)
        Maps the elements of this elements of a new type preserving their order, if any.
        Type Parameters:
        U - Component type of the mapped FilterMonadic
        Parameters:
        mapper - A mapper.
        Returns:
        a mapped FilterMonadic
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if mapper is null
